review_title: Great place to work and innovative work to deliver quality care
pros:
I have been in healthcare for 25 years and this is the best employer i've ever worked for. The pay is good, benefits are decent and flexibility is awesome! 
 They care about the patients and the leaders care about the staff. In the past 2 years I have seen great changes with the new CEO and the leadership team. It's a friendly environment, managers care about you and really listen to concerns and problem solve. It's not always yes but it's let's try to figure this out. I hope to retire here!!
cons: It's hard work, it can be taxing if you don't do proper self-care.

review_title: It's a work from the heart
pros: You have a direct impact on the lives of people that need the most and with people that are willing to help and dedicate their lives to others.
Great people with great attitudes, focus on employee engagement and well being
cons: Pay is lower than industry standards but makes up for it in many ways, quite a bit of turnover

pros: You meet qualified individuals who come and go within healthcare, small world.
cons: Management, treats a person with knowledge by discarding or stealing it as their own. This company is a fish bowl of GOSSIP. They blame good employees and leaders for their lack of knowledge or short comings. Admin is over paid! The mission is forgotten.

job_title: Medical coding and biller in Phoenix, AZ
pros: PS. NONE... I am sorry that this company is still out there.
cons: You do so wrong to employees that give 800% and then you all lie.. Look at you now,,, Sr. Account leaving and the CFO. This companies morals, ethics, should not be in any CTC handbook. Just saying...

pros:
* Serving a most vulnerable population who are in great need of many services
* CTC is based on a mission of providing innovative healthcare compassionately those facing homelessness in the greater Phoenix area.
* Culture is one of respect, dignity, and meeting people where they are.
* Self Care is a regular part of our awareness
* Over the past year, Sr. Leadership has focused primarily on "Our People" taking action with revised PTO policy, adding positions, another holiday, and market adjustments for every position.
* We are a trauma informed organization
* Leadership training and coaching is available
cons:
* Sometimes you experience secondary or vicarious trauma when dealing with folks on the street.
* Lack of housing options for our patients
* Stigmas attached to working with the homeless
Terrible manager , avoid it like a plaque by all means

pros: Nice people that care the homeless
cons: Avoid working in the finance department, the CFO is a nightmare. She had her entire team quit on her at the same time because people hate working with her. She doesn’t understand what her job is and what she should be doing. She gives tasks to others that she can’t complete herself. I don’t know how she got the position but she is not fit for a C-Suite position. She tried to play power games with everyone in the office and can’t seem to figure out how to work as a team player. She wanted to pull money from the bottom level workers and micromanage what they purchase she was mad they were buying things from the dollar store to give out to the homeless if people knew she was misusing their donations to direct cash flow up to the executive suites and not where the money is suppose to be, no one would ever donate to the organization. Shameful behavior.

pros: Phoenix Arizona, Great place to work
cons: None, great place to work as a stepping stone

pros: Amazing co-workers and bosses, great incentives

job_title: Good Place To Work in Phoenix, AZ
pros: It was a very good enviroment and it was very rewarding.
cons: Compensation was less than I would have liked.
